intro: Calycopeplus marginatus, commonly known as the narrow-margin daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a distinctive margin that is often lighter in color than the central part. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a daisy-like pattern. Calycopeplus marginatus is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
